intro: Corydalis bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers well-drained conditions. It has slender, branching stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Corydalis bucharica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
